ch.nolix.system.netNeuron

Class NetBackNeuron<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.system.neuronoid.Neuronoid<NetBackNeuron<I>,I,I>
      • ch.nolix.system.netNeuron.NetBackNeuron<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - The type of the input of a net back neuron.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closable, IFluentObject<NetBackNeuron<I>>, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class NetBackNeuron<I>
extends Neuronoid<NetBackNeuron<I>,I,I>
implements Closable
    A net back neuron is a neuron that can be connected from net front neurons on: -the same process -other processes on the same machine -processes on other machines A net back neuron is closable.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetBackNeuron(int port, IElementTakerElementGetter<I,StandardSpecification> transformator)
      Creates a new net back neuron that will listen to net front neurons on the given port and has the given transformer.

      • NetBackNeuron

        public NetBackNeuron(int port,

        Creates a new net back neuron that will listen to net front neurons on the given port and has the given transformer.
        Parameters:
        port -
        transformator -
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeArgumentException - if the given port is not in [0,65'535].
        NullArgumentException - if the given transformator is null.
